abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that ESPN will broadcast rarely-seen 1966 NCAA men's basketball tournament in which Texas Western started five black players against all-white Kentucky team in championship game; observes that Texas won game 72-65.
lead_paragraph: The 1966 N.C.A.A. championship game remains a landmark event because Texas Western started five black players against an all-white Kentucky. Now it will be seen again on ESPN.

headline.main: A Game Changed History, but It’s Hardly Been Seen Since
headline.print_headline: A Game Changed History, but It’s Hardly Been Seen Since

snippet: The 1966 N.C.A.A. championship game remains a landmark event because Texas Western started five black players against an all-white Kentucky. Now it will be seen again on ESPN.
